results.title: Girl stuff
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Robert Churchill and Barbara Noble
results.brief_description: Aimed at adolescent girls this program covers a range of issues regarding female hygiene. Discusses the pros and cons of deodorants, advice about pelvic infections and changes in the reproductive system at puberty.

results.title: Girl of the Golden West
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, William Anthony McGuire and Robert Z Leonard
results.brief_description: Cowpokes from all around agree. Ain’t nobody like Mary, the tomboy they call “the girl.” She is equally at ease serving a slug of whisky as she is trilling a tune and when it comes to playing a hand of cards to save the neck of the man she loves, she does as any cowboy would, she cheats. Saddling up for this song-filled sagebrusher are Jeanette MacDonald as Mary, and Nelson Eddy as Ramerez, the gold-hearted desperado whom she loves. However, Sheriff Rance (Walter Pidgeon) turns the twosome into a triangle. He’s got an eye for Mary and nothing would please him more than to hold a hanging for Ramerez! Sit back, grab a cuppa and get ready to enjoy a rip-snorting good time!

results.title: Girl interrupted [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Douglas Wick, Cathy Konrad and James Mangold
results.brief_description: Failing to convince a psychiatrist that she is sane after overdosing on aspirins and vodka, troubled teen Susanna Kaysen (Winona Ryder) is prescribed a period of genuine rest at renowned mental institution, Claymoore. Further diagnosed with borderline personality disorder - symptoms of which are mental instability, pessimism, and social contrariness - Susanna is locked away from the outer world and thrust into the company of a group of disturbed young women including Georgina (Clea DuVall), a pathological liar, Daisy (Brittany Murphy), a woman suffering a bizarre eating disorder, and Lisa (Angelina Jolie), a charismatically cruel sociopath. Intrigued by Lisa, Susanna rebels against the authority represented by Nurse Valerie and Dr. Wick, and befriends her fellow inmates, allowing herself to become caught up in their collective madness. Forming a love-hate relationship with Lisa becomes the catalyst for events that ultimately help Susanna to resolve many inner conflicts, and fight her way back to sanity. Based on the autobiographical novel of the same name by Susanna Kaysen. (Awards: Academy for Best Supporting Actress, Anjelina Jolie, 1999)

results.title: Girl in danger: The Case of a pre-delinquent girl
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson Associates and Robert Anderson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Disordered Mind”.
Psychiatrists Dr. June Cumberland and Dr. S.J. Shamsie interview Susan, a thirteen year old girl on the verge of becoming a delinquent. Susan’s parents are also interviewed. Susan is intelligent and a leader; she is thirteen but looks eighteen, and emotionally most of the time is nearer six. She becomes a problem for her parents, her school and herself: she is apparently rushing toward delinquency. Her behaviour is discussed with police, her teachers and in counselling sessions with Susan and her parents. Susan still has problems after seven months of treatment but she has learned how to handle them with more maturity, and has a better relationship with her parents.

results.title: Girl guides parade at Windsor Castle (19/6/1938)
results.brief_description: On June 19, 1938 a thousand Guides from all over the country marched past their majesties the King and Queen in the quadrangle of Windsor Castle. Her Majesty is patroness of the Association. Silent film - no credits or title available.

results.title: Girl guides association international camp
results.brief_description: The first International Girl Guides camp to be held in Australia took place at Yarra Junction, Victoria, in January 1959. The film starts with the arrival of the guides who are from many countries, Great Britain, USA, NZ, and the Far East as well as all Australian states. Their life in camp is depicted and the international aspect emphasised by the exchange of signatures badges and by national dances. The Governor of Victoria, Sir Dallas Brooks, plays a visit to the camp and meets the leaders of each national group.

results.title: Girl groups: the story of a sound
results.creator_credit: Delilah Films, Stephanie Bennett and Steve Alpert
results.brief_description: Traces the story of the dream girls, punctuating over 25 of their greatest hits with fascinating insights into what went on behind the scenes. Highlighted by rare original footage of the groups performing their hits. Includes : The Chantels, The Shirelles, The Shangri-las, Little Eva, The Supremes and more.

results.title: Girl Friday
results.brief_description: Would you spend nine days on a desert island somewhere in the Indian Ocean, exist with a bare minimum of kit, spend your time alone, sleep rough, and make do? Most people would hesitate at accepting such a challenge, but for ex-model and television star Joanna Lumley, the challenge was irresistible. After one day of training with the Irish Guards, she found herself on the proverbial desert island, off Madagascar, and left to fend for herself. This is an account of the way one of Britain’s most popular celebrities adapted to an extreme change of lifestyle, having to literally “live off the land”, finding her own fresh water and food while staving off the intense heat and a myriad of insects. The contrast between Joanna Lumley in these circumstances and her character Patsy in the outrageous “Absolutely fabulous” comedy series is very stark indeed!

results.title: Girl 6 = Girl six
results.creator_credit: 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks, Fox Searchlight Pictures and Spike Lee
results.brief_description: Theresa Randle is an attractive and talented actress but her inability to find acting work leads her to get a job working as a sex-phone operator. Initially suspicious, if intrigued, by the agency she works for, she finds that her work leads to her gaining empowerment over herself and her sexuality. Spike Lee’s “Girl 6” stands as one of his most under-rated films. A clear-sighted examination of fantasy, this film features an excellent cast of women who approach their life, work and relationships with street-smart humour. It is the men around them who find themselves ultimately more repressed by the guilt and shame with which they shroud their sexual fantasies. The film also intelligently and sharply explores the contradictions of race and performance, examining how for an African-American woman the “invisibility” of voice and the phone allows for a greater opportunity of expression than when roles are circumscribed by the hue of her skin colour. This is a vibrant, entertaining and poignant film. Features cameo appearances by Madonna, Quentin Tarantino, Debi Mazar, Naomi Campbell and Halle Berry.

results.title: Girl's sports: on the right track
results.brief_description: Considers the limited opportunities available to women who want to compete in sporting events. Shows how these limitations are being replaced by new opportunities for women in a variety of competitive sports including track and field. Through a short history of track and field, with original archive footage of Babe Didrikson and Wilma Rudolf, the limitations that were available for women to compete in sporting events are shown. The experiences of three high-school girls - a cross-country runner, a shot putter and a broad jumper - shows the new opportunities available for girls today.
